text: Terrasse tranquille , bonne bouffe sauf que ce dimanche pas possible d avoir tous les oeufs avec la sauce hollandaise ( pour un brunch un dimanche ...) et service déplorable, il faut réclamer le cafe, attendre la bière, réclamer l eau . Dommage

Horrible service.15 minutes to get anyone at table.Then a confused lady came with coffee.. Didn't take order said she'll send someone.. Then 10 minutes later we're asked to move to different table .. Although the place was almost empty... Update: the food arrived.. Really bad.. Eggs were watery :benedict" hollandaise sauce watery.. Soggy English muffin.. Potatoes are from frozen.. And the fruits literally had fridge taste...

The service was not good at all. I ordered a Chicken burger and it came with chicken thigh instead of chicken breast. The people who ate with me were also complaining their food was not good. It seemed pricey for what you got. Definitevely NOT going back there...

We literally stumbled into this place while wandering along Duluth after a climb up Mont-Royal. It was late lunchtime and empty. The proprietor, who at first seemed diffident and distant, warmed up when I told him I wanted vino verde with my grilled sardines. "Have you had it before?" He asked. I said, "Yes, in Lisbon." In that moment, everything changed, and our lunch of Portuguese style sardines with vegetables, salad, and vino verde turned into a long and leisurely conversation about Oporto, Lisbon, family, the benefits of eating oily fish, the Baltimore Ravens...to me it was pure Portuguese hospitality. And some of the best grilled sardines ever.

I ate here once for lunch. Grilled chicken (see photo), I remember I liked it but I think it was a bit more on the salty side and slight uncook on the inside. The ambiance of the place was nice,heavy on the bar side, a very typical catering for Montreal's summer tourists.

J'y suis allée à 2 reprises. J'ai bien aimé le poulet portugais mais je dois avouer que l'assiette de sardines grillées m'a beaucoup plus impressionné. Les pasteis de Natas restent un incontournable. Ils servent la Super Bock et la Sagres, 2 bières portugaises.  L'ambiance est chaleureuse, familiale. On s'y sent bien. La raison pour laquelle j'ai mis 4 étoiles est le service. Il faut attendre, réclamer l'eau, réclamer le café. Mais sinon, j'aime beaucoup. Après faut aimer pour y retourner à 2 reprises, non?

Voici encore un énième restaurant dont on ressort sans y avoir rien gagné: la bouffe n'est pas sensationnelle, le service ne fait pas rêver, la déco et l'ambiance y sont quelconques. Bref, on en sort 80$ plus tard en se disant que quitte à bouffer de l'insipide, on aurait pu aller manger dans un fast-food, on en aurait pour beaucoup moins cher... Ou se payer un vrai restaurant pour la même somme.

Well, we went in search of a pleasant Portuguese restaurant for the evening, and we discovered Na Brasa.  What a pleasant discovery!  The staff were wonderful.  And the food was delicious.  If we lived here, we would be frequent diners.  Plus the house wine was just right.
Les moules frites à volonté du Dimanche au Mercredi, la sangria et la terrasse... rien à ajouter !
Outdoor meal in the summer.  Loved the grilled vegetables and an excellent salad.  We were surprised and impressed.

Easy-going Portuguese place with a patio on the Duluth cobblestones. I'd been here a bunch years ago when the Doxas brothers used to jam and you could see some of the city's best young jazz in front of a tiny crowd. After a bit of an accidental hiatus, I had an impromptu dinner party here recently. One warm and breezy evening on the terrasse we ordered a hearty mix of tapas and mixed grill and really enjoyed everything that came rolling out hot as soon as it was ready: the sardines, chicken, chorizo, grilled veggies, pork, grilled calamari, and oh yes also the pitchers of beer all seemed perfect in that moment (admittedly a little extra glossed from street festing.) Nothing fancy, but fresh nice food, served by older, yet still swarthy and handsome Portuguese gentlemen with sunny senses of humour and good karmic food timing.

Je suis rentrée dans ce restaurant par hasard mais en voyant les sardines grillées sur la carte (j'en avais envie depuis tellement longtemps) je suis entrée.  Restaurant à l'ambiance feutrée où l'on est pas les uns sur les autres et qui sert une très bonne cuisine. Il y a même un chanteur qui saura parfaitement animer vos soirées d'anniversaire !
